utils/fcamDngUtil.cpp

00001 
00002 // Simple utility to manipulate FCam-produced DNG files
00003 // 
00004 
00005 #if !defined(FCAM_VERSION)
00006 #define FCAM_VERSION "x.x.x"
00007 #endif
00008 
00009 #include <FCam/FCam.h>
00010 #include <stdio.h>
00011 #include <unistd.h>
00012 
00013 void usage() {
00014     printf("fcamDngUtil\n"
00015            "  (FCam version " FCAM_VERSION ")\n"
00016            "  A simply utility to manipulate DNGs saved by programs using\n"
00017            "  the FCam API.\n\n"
00018 
00019            "Usage: fcamDngUtil [FLAGS] INPUT [OUTPUT].\n"
00020            "  With no output name given, adds .up. before the .dng extension to\n"
00021            "  the input to create the output name for DNG output, and uses the\n"
00022            "  input file name with the .jpg extension for JPEG.\n"
00023            "Flags:\n"
00024            "  -i Dump out information about the DNG contents\n"
00025            "  -u Write a new DNG with metadata updated to the latest version.\n"
00026            "  -j Write a JPEG file created from the input DNG.\n" 
00027            "     If -u is also specified, only -j takes effect.\n"
00028            "  -c Specify a different contrast amount for JPEG conversion\n"
00029            "     (default = 50, range 0-100, larger numbers increase contrast.)\n"
00030            "  -b Specify a different black level for JPEG conversion (default = 25).\n"
00031            "  -g Specify a different gamma value for JPEG conversion (default = 2.2).\n"
00032            "  -q Specify JPEG quality (default = 80, range 0-100).\n"
00033            "  -n Turn off hot pixel suppression.\n"
00034            "\n");
00035     exit(1);
00036 }
00037 
00038 int main(int argc, char **argv) {
00039     if (argc < 2) {
00040         usage();
00041     }
00042 
00043     bool dumpFrame = false;
00044     bool writeDNG = false;
00045     bool writeJPEG = false;
00046 
00047     bool denoise = true;
00048     int contrast = 50;
00049     int blackLevel = 25;
00050     float gamma = 2.2f;
00051     int quality = 80;
00052 
00053     const char *options="iujc:b:g:nq:";
00054     
00055     int argChar;
00056     while (  (argChar = getopt(argc,argv,options)) != -1) {
00057         switch (argChar) {
00058         case 'i':
00059             dumpFrame = true;
00060             break;
00061         case 'u':
00062             writeDNG = true;
00063             break;
00064         case 'j':
00065             writeJPEG = true;
00066             break;
00067         case 'c':
00068             sscanf(optarg,"%d", &contrast);
00069             break;
00070         case 'b':
00071             sscanf(optarg,"%d", &blackLevel);
00072             break;
00073         case 'g':
00074             sscanf(optarg,"%f", &gamma);
00075             break;
00076         case 'n':
00077             denoise = false;
00078             break;
00079         case 'q':
00080             sscanf(optarg,"%d", &quality);
00081             break;
00082         case '?':
00083             usage();
00084             break;
00085         }
00086     }
00087 
00088     if (optind == argc) {
00089         printf("!! Error: No input file given!\n\n");
00090         usage();
00091     }
00092 
00093     std::string inputFile(argv[optind]);
00094 
00095     std::string outputFile;
00096     if (optind < argc -1 ) {
00097         outputFile = std::string(argv[optind+1]);
00098     } else {
00099         if (writeJPEG) {
00100             outputFile = inputFile.substr(0,inputFile.rfind(".dng"));
00101             outputFile.append(".jpg");
00102         } else {
00103             outputFile = inputFile.substr(0,inputFile.rfind(".dng"));
00104             outputFile.append(".up.dng");
00105         }
00106     }
00107 
00108     if (!dumpFrame && !writeJPEG && !writeDNG) {
00109         printf("!! Error: Nothing to do\n\n");
00110         usage();
00111     }
00112 
00113     FCam::Event e;
00114 
00115     printf("  Reading input DNG %s\n", inputFile.c_str());
00116 
00117     FCam::DNGFrame f = FCam::loadDNG(inputFile);
00118 
00119     if (FCam::_eventQueue.size() > 0) {
00120         printf("  Events reported while loading DNG:\n");
00121         while (getNextEvent(&e)) {
00122             switch (e.type) {
00123             case FCam::Event::Error:
00124                 printf("    Error code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.data, e.description.c_str());
00125                 break;
00126             case FCam::Event::Warning:
00127                 printf("    Warning code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.data, e.description.c_str());
00128                 break;
00129             default:
00130                 printf("    Event type %d, code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.type, e.data, e.description.c_str());
00131                 break;
00132             }
00133         }
00134     }
00135 
00136     if (!f.valid()) {
00137         printf("!! Error: Unable to read input file %s\n", inputFile.c_str());
00138         exit(1);
00139     }
00140 
00141     if (dumpFrame) {
00142         f.debug(inputFile.c_str());
00143     }
00144 
00145     if (writeJPEG) {
00146         printf("  Demosaicing with contrast %d, black level %d, gamma %f %s\n", contrast, blackLevel, gamma, denoise ? "":"(Denoising off)");
00147         FCam::Image jpegImg = FCam::demosaic(f, contrast, denoise, blackLevel, gamma);        
00148         if (FCam::_eventQueue.size() > 0) {
00149             printf("Events reported while demosaicing DNG:\n");
00150             while (getNextEvent(&e)) {
00151                 switch (e.type) {
00152                 case FCam::Event::Error:
00153                     printf("  Error code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.data, e.description.c_str());
00154                     break;
00155                 case FCam::Event::Warning:
00156                     printf("  Warning code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.data, e.description.c_str());
00157                     break;
00158                 default:
00159                     printf("  Event type %d, code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.type, e.data, e.description.c_str());
00160                     break;
00161                 }
00162             }
00163         }        
00164         if (!jpegImg.valid()) {
00165             printf("!! Error: Unable to demosaic input file %s\n", inputFile.c_str());
00166             exit(1);
00167         }
00168         printf("  Writing to %s, quality %d\n", outputFile.c_str(), quality);
00169         saveJPEG(jpegImg, outputFile, quality);
00170 
00171         if (FCam::_eventQueue.size() > 0) {
00172             printf("Events reported while saving JPEG:\n");
00173             while (getNextEvent(&e)) {
00174                 switch (e.type) {
00175                 case FCam::Event::Error:
00176                     printf("  Error code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.data, e.description.c_str());
00177                     break;
00178                 case FCam::Event::Warning:
00179                     printf("  Warning code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.data, e.description.c_str());
00180                     break;
00181                 default:
00182                     printf("  Event type %d, code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.type, e.data, e.description.c_str());
00183                     break;
00184                 }
00185             }
00186         }
00187               
00188     } else if (writeDNG) {
00189         printf("  Writing updated DNG to %s\n", outputFile.c_str());
00190         FCam::saveDNG(f, outputFile);
00191         
00192         if (FCam::_eventQueue.size() > 0) {
00193             printf("  Events reported while saving to %s:\n", outputFile.c_str());
00194             while (getNextEvent(&e)) {
00195                 switch (e.type) {
00196                 case FCam::Event::Error:
00197                     printf("    Error code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.data, e.description.c_str());
00198                     break;
00199                 case FCam::Event::Warning:
00200                     printf("    Warning code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.data, e.description.c_str());
00201                     break;
00202                 default:
00203                     printf("    Event type %d, code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.type, e.data, e.description.c_str());
00204                     break;
00205                 }
00206             }
00207         }
00208     }
00209     printf("  Done!\n");
00210     return 0;
00211 }
